channel.title: I'll Rep++ If You Help Me
channel.description: Is there a good webclient that someone has the embed code to so i can add it to my site :D I'll rep++ if ya give me the code :)

item.title: I'll Rep++ If You Help Me
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Rog3r, post:1, topic:218729”][size=17pt]Website with it![/size]

First 2 pages you see are backup’s and DO NOT work… go into the folder further and they will work.
You must write some things - I left my old text… but on the pictures I blocked the name.
Oh yah, some of the format may be off - but if you have some basic HTML knowledge, you will fix it.

Download: http://uppit.com/5B417V
Features: Extended play - used for websites (contians no mysql)[/quote]

idk what that’s about, i looked at it for a bit. see if that helps. im off though, going to bed. bye

Read full topic
item.source: I'll Rep++ If You Help Me

item.title: I'll Rep++ If You Help Me
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

dagger9090:

I DONT NO HOW TO MAKE A WEBCLIENT UGH!!! JUST GIVE ME THE EMBED CODE TO ONE SO I CAN PUT IT ON MY SITE FFS!

That is the embed code, you idiot. That code embed’s it to the webpage so you can load the web client. The web client is just a jar file with the code, nothing else. If you don’t know how to make a web client you should have said it in the first place.

Look in the client hacking section. Or use the search bar to find a tutorial on how to make a web client.

Read full topic

item.source: I'll Rep++ If You Help Me

item.title: I'll Rep++ If You Help Me
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

dagger9090:

can someone just post a embed code if they got one please

[quote=“Hidendra, post:2, topic:230352”]if you already have a webclient, use (html tag) … If not, make a web client and use that.


<applet code="client.class" name="NAME.." archive="NAMEOFJAR.jar" width="765" height="565">
Enable Java! 
</applet>

If the main class is NOT client.class, change it. Change NAME… to name of it… NAMEOFJAR.jar to the jar’s file name. (etc)[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: I'll Rep++ If You Help Me
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

if you already have a webclient, use (html tag) … If not, make a web client and use that.


<applet code="client.class" name="NAME.." archive="NAMEOFJAR.jar" width="765" height="565">
Enable Java! 
</applet>

If the main class is NOT client.class, change it. Change NAME… to name of it… NAMEOFJAR.jar to the jar’s file name. (etc)

Read full topic
